I play only as survivor and for me, the perks are useless.

If you don't play the meta perks then you will lose 90%+ of the matches.



I get caught by the killers way too fast because:

-the pallets are already destroyed

-bloodlust level 100

-their speed > my speed

-god-level swings with god-level pings

-camping and tunneling



[b]Trapper[/b]
-quite easy to pass by his traps, just pay attention on the ground


[b]Wraith[/b]
-he can be invisible and is a nightmare


[b]Hillbilly[/b]
-kinda easy to pass his chainsaw if you're not running in a straight line
-can traverse the map in just a matter of seconds


[b]Nurse[/b]
-kinda easy to pass her blinks
-the pallets are almost useless


[b]Michael Myers[/b]
-hard to spot (almost no heartbeat at tier 1)
-easy to run from him until he reaches tier 2 / 3 (high speed and exposed effect)


[b]Hag[/b]
-the traps are a nightmare if you don't have a flashlight
--would be nice if you could see the marks on the ground because she clearly scratches the ground


[b]Doctor[/b]
-way too hard to play against him as he can send you in the third state of madness
-he can spot you easily using his ability
-once in the third state, everything becomes harder
--would be nice to have something like a cleansing object on the map (like the ones from Plague) where you can decrease the states

[b]Huntress[/b]
-easy to dodge the hatchets
--nice lullaby


[b]Bubba[/b]
-almost the same as Hillbilly


[b]Freddy Krueger[/b]
-(old) very annoying because you can't see him even if the grass moves you can barely run from his ability
-(new) seems to be way too overpowered about everything he can do


[b]Pig[/b]
-hard to spot when she's crouched and you may think it's a Claudette
-annoying dash speed because she can get you really fast


[b]Clown[/b]
-kinda easy to dodge his bottles, but once hit, you may be slowed down and caught


[b]Spirit[/b]
-very annoying because while she's in the Phase Walk she can be really fast and can see the scratch marks and hear the survivors she's passing by


[b]Legion[/b]
-two hits and you're down - one with the ability and the other one is a basic hit - because people now runs towards you with the ability and then hits you with the basic attack


[b]Plague[/b]
-kinda easy to run away from her, but once she's got the Corrupt Purge, she can easily snipe you from across the map


[b]Ghost Face[/b]
-very hard to spot him and very hard to snap him out of his power
-once spotted, you have around 20s to escape the insta-down hit
--would be nice if the (circle) timer of his "Stalking" could reset when you snap him out because everyone will keep it at 99% just to get closer and insta-down you



The maps are a nightmare - let's assume you're the only one alive and you want to open the door. Guess what - in 90% of the cases you won't be able to do that because the doors are way too close to each other and the killers can camp them very easily.



Yes, the game is nice to play.
Yes, it has a nice concept with nice game mechanics.
Yes, the graphics and the sound are good.
Yes, the stories of both survivors and killers are nice.

Yes. I get it - "there's no <<you win / you lose>> message on the screen when the game is over so you don't have to worry about who loses or who wins" - but having half of your teammates downed, camped and tunneled in the first minutes of the game isn't fun at all.

Yes, I get it - "you're with 3 other survivors, while the killer is only by itself" - yes, correct, but their speed, "camping and tunneling abilities", body-blocking you on the way out of the killer's shack is too overpowered.

Yes, I get it - "this is how the killers should be - faster and stronger than the survivors because that's how's in the movies" and so on, but in this game they seem overpowered maybe mostly because of their speed.



5 minutes into the game and my team is already hooked - this isn't fun.


I'm not a Level-1 survivor player. I don't know the maps, the good or bad loops, the fast or slow vaults, the pallets' places very well - maybe not even 10%.



This game is based on cooperation (you get points for that), but surprise - you can't communicate with your teammates (besides of the two silly emotes).


But maybe a chat system would be more than enough in this game like the one in the DEATHGARDEN: BLOODHARVEST - Behaviour's other game; a game almost similar to this one. Maybe with a chat system everything I've written above would become useless.



Maybe if the killers would get crows above them like the survivors do when they're "AFK" would be a nice touch against the campers.
Maybe if when the same survivor is getting chased in less than 1-2 minutes from being unhooked, the killer would get a decreased speed or there won't be scratch marks for that specific survivor for a specific amount of time - to fight against tunneling.


Yes, I get it - "they're killers, this is their job - to stop the survivors from evading the trial" - that's correct, but something is being forgotten here - this is a game and you must enjoy playing a game.



I don't want to win every time I play - I want to have fun every time I play. If I've fun when I'm playing, but I lose in the game, then I take it as a win.



[spoiler]Maybe if I was a main killer, I'd say that the survivors are overpowered with or without perks.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]Nothing is balanced - everything for everyone is either useless or overpowered.
You find a perk too useless? Someone may find it too overpowered.
You find a loop too useless? Someone may find it too overpowered.[/spoiler]
pretty good job so far

It is a fun game to play especially with friends in a public match as survivors or in a kill your friends match and take it in turns to be the killer. So it appeals to a few people for the options you can play as. You will always come across a few people that suck the fun out of a match by camping and tunnelling you as a survivor. But also as a killer it gets annoying to be trolled by some people. But i really love the game and they are always coming out with new dlc such as killers that are licensed from films like Micheal Myers and Freddy Kruger and more, and other killers they design themselves, with new survivors too. But now we can buy or earn points to spend on custom outfits or even to buy the characters in the game which is really cool, so you can customise your survivor anyway you like and with their own perks of your choice. Definetly a fun game overall though.

Zusammengefasst wartet ihr 30 Minuten auf eine 5 Minuten Runde, und in vielen FÃ¤llen wird die Wartezeit mehr SpaÃŸ machen als die eigentliche Runde, in der ihr professionell gemobbt werdet. NatÃ¼rlich gibt es auch Ausnahmen: manche Runden machen tatsÃ¤chlich SpaÃŸ, sowohl als Killer, als auch als Survivor. Doch mit DbD Runden verhÃ¤lt es sich Ã¤hnlich wie mit KopfschÃ¼ssen: Nur, weil man sie mit einer geringen Chance Ã¼berleben kann, sind sie noch lange nicht super. Als Kirsche auf dem SahnehÃ¤ubchen gibt es dann noch die unzÃ¤hligen Bugs, die ihren Ursprung in einem geistig eher schwerfÃ¤lligerem Entwicklerteam haben.

Ich hoffe dieses Review hilft euch, auf dem rechten Pfad zu bleiben und eine Kaufentscheidung zu Ã¼berdenken.

TL;DR - 4 bullies vs 1 victim. Devs don't care to listen or address issues. They don't call it "Looped til Daylight" for no reason.

Don't be fooled by the promise of an asymmetrical 1v4 with a powerful killer and a team of weak survivors, because the killers hold no agency in this game. If you play killer, expect to get picked on and bullied every match by any survivor with more than 20 hours of experience.

Survivors are only unique in their voice acting and appearance, and the role is both boring and easy. Looping killers is incredibly simple, and most survivor players act like it takes skill to boost their own ego. To make matters worse, every survivor who wants to win has been running the same 4 meta perks for the entirety of this game's life, and despite regular updates the devs have never meaningfully attempted to change this. Adrenaline, Decisive Strike, Dead Hard, and Self Care with the occasional Borrowed Time mixed in. If that wasn't bad enough, survivors are free to team up and enter queue together, using external comms to convey critical information to each other with zero restrictions, making the killer's role even more impossibly aggravating. Basically, they can cheat, the devs encourage it, and to the killer it will seem as if the survivors have a sixth sense.

On the Killer side of things, the most egregious offender is Hex:Ruin, which is an absolutely mandatory perk for any killer to have a chance at killing everyone. Because survivors are so powerful and they have no actual control, killers are forced to abuse toxic playstyles on the regular to ensure success. Tunneling and camping the first survivor hit until they're dead is the best way for killers to slow down the game and give themselves a good chance at killing everyone. Being that targeted survivor sucks, and it just feeds into a cycle of toxicity. 

That's what the meta of this game is. Toxic. Survivors run killers in circles all day, and killers tunnel/camp survivors out of rage or desperation, and both sides come out of it feeling like the victim.

And as if all of the above weren't reason enough to avoid this game, it's also addicting. There aren't many games that attempt the asymmetrical setup with the side of Few being innately powerful and dominant, and the side of Many having to overcome their weakness through teamwork. But don't be fooled, the side of Few in Dead by Daylight holds no power, and the side of Many hardly requires any teamwork.

Don't get addicted. Hard pass on this game.
